channel.title: Seismic on Zoltán Sylvester
channel.description: Recent content in Seismic on Zoltán Sylvester

item.title: Stretching the truth: vertical exaggeration of seismic data
item.description: If someone showed a photograph of the famous Cuernos massif (Torres del Paine National Park, Chile) like the one below, it would be - probably, hopefully - obvious to everybody that something is wrong with the picture. Our eyes and brains have seen enough mountain scenery that we intuitively know how steep is ‘steep’ in alpine landscapes. The peaks in this photograph just look too extreme, too high if one takes into account their lateral extent.
